alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 9:49PM CDT until April 11 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Wilcox and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 40 feet, considerable flooding of agricultural land. At 42 feet, water begins to inundate the Eureka Landing community. At 43 feet, access to Eureka Landing community stops, with access cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 41.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 44 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 42 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
